description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ucql","text":"This protocol describes isolation of nuclei from fresh-frozen human knee subchondral bone for use in Omics analyses, including RNA-sequencing of ATAC-sequencing. Tissue dissociation was the most critical step in optimization which was monitored by nuclei yield, integrity and purity. Methods for quality control are also described.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

number: F23001)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0394","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egsqc","text":"Nuclei Recipes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqlcv","text":"Wash Buffer (see Recipes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a7ga","text":"*Diluent buffer in Distilled Nuclease free water and sterile filtered before use (see Recipes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73olf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vjrk","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33k3t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j2a2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3tbf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bau0o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n08k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3758v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"79dq6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"628sm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvv5b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cft1c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpssp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7qeo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vl9c","text":"Nuclei Isolation Protocol Using the Singulator S200","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"699he","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kqda","text":"We use fresh snapfrozen tissues stored in Liquid Nitrogen (LN).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c085v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2r5tj","text":"1.1.\tPre-chill mortar and pestle with LN. Place 200mg snapfrozen bone into a mortar, add LN and smash (do not grind) several times with a pestle until it is dissociated. Make sure that the tissue is in tiny fragments while trying not to grind it, as grinding creates more nuclei damage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbtq8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"348ms","text":"1.2. Transfer tissue fragments to a 50 ml tube with 2 ml lysis buffer and incubate for 20 min at 4°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmeqp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rqbh","text":"1.3. After this incubation, add 2 ml wash buffer to the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31jct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h14s","text":"1.4. Pass the nuclei suspension sequentially through 40 μm, 20 μm, and 10μm strainers into a 50-ml conical centrifuge tube on ice. Do not apply negative pressure. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1g4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chkc9","text":"1.5.\tTransfer the flow-through to a 5 ml LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8b8o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fsbb","text":"1.6.\tCentrifuge at 500 rcf for 5 min at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"domqr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d1p8c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sdt4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bupo0","text":"1.7.\tRemove supernatant carefully and resuspend in 400μL PBS + Recombinant Albumin 0.03 mg/ml + 1U/μl RNase Inhibitor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5i0m1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l20","text":"1.8.\tTo remove cellular debris, spin down at 4℃, 150 rfc for 10 min to pellet the nuclei and retain the small debris in the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rbpi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29nbc","text":"1.9.\tRemove supernatant and resuspend in 400μL PBS + Recombinant Albumin\n(0.03mg/ml) + 1U/μl RNase Inhibitor. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlvqu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chkev","text":"1.10. Count nuclei using a Countess II FL Automated Cell Counter (AOPI staining).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44ilu","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qrv7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63dcp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5mv4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kg6u","text":"1.11. Nuclei should be visualized under a microscope at 40x or 60x magnification (AOPI staining) to assess nuclear membrane integrity, according to the nuclear integrity quality check guidance by 10x (https://10xgenomics.com).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":201,"length":25}],"data":{}},{"key":"dbpkn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g4p9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3lvq2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"54ak6","text":"A: High-quality nuclei have well-resolved edges. Optimal quality for single-cell gene expression libraries.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ur4i","text":"B: Mostly intact nuclei with minor evidence of blebbing. Quality single-cell gene expression libraries can still be produced.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vbd5","text":"C: Nuclei with strong evidence of blebbing. Proceed at your own risk.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e29i2","text":"D: Nuclei are no longer intact. Do not proceed!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4aavk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ja1c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1coqa","text":"1.12. Centrifuge at 500 rcf for 5 min at 4°C and remove the supernatant without disrupting the nuclei pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbko9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3blpp","text":"1.13. Based on the nuclei concentration estimated at step 1.9, resuspend nuclei pellet in chilled Diluted Nuclei Buffer to a target concentration of 4,000 – 5,000 nuclei/ul, for a target nuclei recovery of 20,000 nuclei.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f3o1","text":"* Put only 5 μL into the PCR tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"s90q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brvu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1dh5","text":"1.14. Proceed immediately to Chromium Next GEM Single Cell Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression User Guide (CG000338) and minimize the time between nuclei preparation and chip loading.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":213.51818181818177,"id":483337,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"Screen status.info: We use this document and it's working for our 10x Multiome Single Nuclei sequencing.
